definition: to adhere/to stick together/to bond/to agglutinate/adhesion/adhesive
sticky/glutinous/(Tw) to adhere/to stick on/to glue
(chess) move/trick/all right!/(dialect) to add
to wear (clothes)/to contact/to use/to apply
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress
agglutinative (in linguistics, a characteristic of Altaic languages)
adhesion/adhesive force
agglutinative language (e.g. Turkish and Japanese)

sentences.english: That is to say, I don't like agglutinative languages and inflecting languages.
sentences.chinese: 就是说，我不喜欢黏着语和屈折语。

sentences.english: I went back to page one, girded up my typewriter and my critical faculty and started over.
sentences.chinese: 我重返第一页，黏着打字机，努力工作，从头开始。

sentences.english: Objective To explore the changes of expression of focal adhesion kinase in different stages of the development of lungs.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨大鼠肺发育不同阶段黏着斑激酶表达的变化。

sentences.english: The children cling to their father for more pocket money.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们黏着爸爸，要他再给此零花钱。
